answers.author: Jeffrey Howell
answers.text:
The following are excerpts from our Financial Management Policy Statements:
The City shall strive to maintain the General Fund undesignated fund balance at 25 percent of current year budget expenditures. After completion of the annual audit, if the undesignated fund balance exceeds twenty-five (25) percent, the City Council will be provided the option of transferring the excess to the Capital Projects Fund (undesignated). 
Fund Balance/Retained Earnings shall be used only for emergencies, not recurring expenditures, or major capital purchases that cannot be accommodated through current year savings. Should such use reduce the balance below the appropriate level set as the objective for that fund, recommendations will be made on how to restore it.

3. We have no policy in place

author: Donald Gloo
text:
I am posting this question on behalf of a city in Kentucky.

How does your organization determine the target amount for your General Fund Reserve?  Is it a % of the GF budget?
What mechanism(s) does your organization use to increase your GF Reserve balance when it is short of the target?
Does your organization have a written policy for determining when the GF Reserve can--or cannot--be tapped?

If possible, please send a copy of your policy language to twilson@lexingtonky.gov.
Thanks!
